creator: vimages@well.com
text:
Amusing. If a user tries to open a last-ditch menu item in W32, they will be
taken to a text page that is rather unhelpful.

To reproduce:

1) Using Windows, Open: Start -> Programs -> Apache HTTP Server 2.0.47 -> Help
I'm Stuck!

results: User is presented with a page that reads: 

"URI: index.html.en Content-Language: en Content-type: text/html;
charset=ISO-8859-1"

In my case the path is ../Apache%20Group/Apache2/manual/faq/index.html but the
.html file simply contains the above text. 

expected results: Page represents the index page of a FAQ or manual.

NOTE: There are several other .html files in the same directory that are not
complete.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
You're right that's pretty silly; It's caused by a change we made to the
configuration of the manual.  

Probably it should just point at the FAQ on the website, since there is
no guarentee the users manual will be working at the time the user needs
help.

This has been fixed in the 2.2 branch. 
As well as the last 4 version in the 2.0 branch.

Cheers,
Tony
creator: tony@pc-tony.com
